intro: Sacciolepis chantaranothaiana, commonly known as the Malagasy starflower, is a rare and unique plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the specific microclimates of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
